Authors:
Nayyereh Alimadadi, Hamid Reza Pourianfar, Mohammad Ali
Amoozegar , Seyyed Sajad Zabihi, Valiollah Mahdizadeh, Seyed Abolhassan
Shahzadeh Fazeli
Title:
Molecular identification of some wild medicinal macrofungi
from Northern Iran
Keywords:
Internal transcribed spacer region, Iran, Macrofungi,
Mazandaran province
Abstract:
In last decades, macrofungi have attracted increasing
attention because of their beneficial nutritional and medicinal
properties. In this study, a total of 181 macrofungal samples were
collected from forests in Mazandaran province, Iran. Pure mycelial
cultures were successfully obtained from 91 collected samples. Regarding
morphological data, 47 isolates were selected for molecular
identification based on internal transcribed spacer region (ITS)
sequence analysis. The results showed that the 38 macrofungal isolates
were belonging to 22 species, 19 genera, 10 families and 5 orders. Most
of the macrofungi (47%) were identified as Trametes and Ganoderma
species. Three isolates identified as Hohenbuehelia sp., Polyporellus
brumalis and Ceriporia lacerata were new records for Iran fungal flora.
This study increases the knowledge on Iranian macrofungal diversity and
facilitates future genetic and biotechnological investigations on these
macrofungi.
